summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Judge Nathan's chambers regarding the case United States v. Maxwell. It transmits the Government's responsive letter and a proposed sealed exhibit concerning redactions to letter briefing related to a defense motion to modify the Protective Order. A redacted public version has also been filed.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN). The correspondence is addressed to her chambers regarding a court order and proposed redactions.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN). The document concerns a motion related to the protective order in her case.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the email, submitting the Government's responsive letter and proposed sealed exhibit to the court.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Prosecutor for the government in the criminal case against the defendant Maxwell.
Judge presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order on Redaction Proposals
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order directing the parties to propose redactions to letter briefing regarding the defendant's motion to modify the Protective Order.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Government Submits Responsive Letter
events.description: The Government submits its responsive letter and a proposed sealed exhibit (Exhibit A) to Judge Nathan's chambers regarding the proposed redactions and sealing.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is a procedural filing in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It concerns a defense motion to modify the court's Protective Order, with the parties proposing redactions to related letter briefing.
The Government submitted a responsive letter and a proposed sealed exhibit (Exhibit A) for the court's review.
A redacted version of the Government's letter was filed on the public docket.
